alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 8:23PM EST until March 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. For the Big Creek...including Cumming, Alpharetta, Roswell...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding of woodlands and fields begin along the creek between Cumming in Forsyth County...to Alpharetta and Roswell in North Fulton County. Flooding starts to effect portions of The Big Creek Greenway near Alpharetta and some portions may become closed with around one foot of water...especially upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill Park. Portions of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 5.3 feet and rising rapidly. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 7.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 7 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
